article_title: SNCF Seeks EU4 Billion of Savings by 2015, Les Echos Says
article_text: SHARE THIS ARTICLE   Share   Tweet   Post   Email  {"contentId":"LDPT1G0YHQ0X01","position":"brokerboxarticle","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[120,60]],"small_desktop":[[120,60]],"tablet":[[120,60]]},"strategy":"viewable","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"brokerboxarticle1","url":"/news/articles/2010-12-20/sncf-seeks-eu4-billion-of-savings-by-2015-les-echos-says"},"containerId":"brokerboxarticle-oUypgEc"}   Societe Nationale des Chemins de Fer Francais, the French state-owned rail operator, is aiming for 4 billion euros ($5.26 billion) of savings by 2015, Les Echos reported, citing the company’s 2011 budget.    SNCF plans purchasing savings and will limit investments and reduce its workforce to reach the objective, the French daily said.    The company plans to lower costs by 550 million euros next year, Les Echos said. The company will cut 1,400 jobs in 2011, it added. SNCF expects sales to reach 33.6 billion euros in 2011, up 10 percent from 2010, according to the newspaper.
